summary.p: 8 fol.; Writing surface: parchment; Shelfmark: R. 16; Qurʾānic Text: Q 39:73-40:34; 10 lines per page; Dimensions: 345 x 250mm; Script style: kūfī.

This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. With exceptions, the catalogue does not contain precise information on the distribution of the text throughout the pages. For this reason, only fol. 1 is given.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, p. 19f: "55 R. 16 Kur’an’dan bir bölüm. Parşömen. 250 mm boy ve 345 mm eninde cönk formasında 8 yaprak. Sahifede kûfî ile 250 mm uzunl.[uğunda] 10 satır. Tahminen III. (IX). asırda kopya edilmiştir. Kenarları kâğıtla vassaleli ve cetvelleri yaldızlıdır. Miklepli koyu kahve rengi deri cilt. Bu ciltte Y. 1a Zumar (39) suresinin 73. ayetin وفتحت ابوابها cümlesiyle başlıyor; Y. 1b Mü’min (40) suresine geçiyor ve Y. 8b de aynı surenin 34. ayetinin sonlarında حتى اذا هلك قلتم لن يبعث ا (لله) ibaresiyle bitiyor."

This can be translated as follows: "55 R. 16 A part of the Qurʾān. Parchment. 8 junk shaped leaves of 250 mm height and 345 mm width. The text area written in Kufic script [contains] 10 lines measuring 250 mm. Probably copied during the 3rd (9th) century. The [leaf] edges include the technique of vaṣṣālī with paper and the rule-borders are gilded. Dark brown leather binding with flap (miklep). The fragment begins with وفتحت ابوابها of Q 39:73 (Sūra al-Zumar) and passes to Q 40 (Sūra al-Muʾmin) on [Leaf] L. 1b, and it ends with the words حتى اذا هلك قلتم لن يبعث ا (لله) towards the end of verse 34 of the same sūra on [Leaf] L. 8b."
